trans-unit.source: Share certificates between apps
trans-unit.target: Share certificates between apps

trans-unit.source: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps that require secure authentication beyond a user Id and password combination can use certificates for authentication.
trans-unit.target: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps that require secure authentication beyond a user Id and password combination can use certificates for authentication.

trans-unit.source: Share certificates between apps
trans-unit.target: Share certificates between apps

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps that require secure authentication beyond a user Id and password combination can use certificates for authentication.
trans-unit.target: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps that require secure authentication beyond a user Id and password combination can use certificates for authentication.

trans-unit.source: Certificate authentication provides a high level of trust when authenticating a user.
trans-unit.target: Certificate authentication provides a high level of trust when authenticating a user.

trans-unit.source: In some cases, a group of services will want to authenticate a user for multiple apps.
trans-unit.target: In some cases, a group of services will want to authenticate a user for multiple apps.

trans-unit.source: This article shows how you can authenticate multiple apps using the same certificate, and how you can provide convenient code for a user to import a certificate that was provided to access secured web services.
trans-unit.target: This article shows how you can authenticate multiple apps using the same certificate, and how you can provide convenient code for a user to import a certificate that was provided to access secured web services.

trans-unit.source: Apps can authenticate to a web service using a certificate, and multiple apps can use a single certificate from the certificate store to authenticate the same user.
trans-unit.target: Apps can authenticate to a web service using a certificate, and multiple apps can use a single certificate from the certificate store to authenticate the same user.

trans-unit.source: If a certificate does not exist in the store, you can add code to your app to import a certificate from a PFX file.
trans-unit.target: If a certificate does not exist in the store, you can add code to your app to import a certificate from a PFX file.

trans-unit.source: Enable Microsoft Internet Information Services (IIS) and client certificate mapping
trans-unit.target: Enable Microsoft Internet Information Services (IIS) and client certificate mapping

trans-unit.source: This article uses Microsoft Internet Information Services (IIS) for example purposes.
trans-unit.target: This article uses Microsoft Internet Information Services (IIS) for example purposes.

trans-unit.source: IIS is not enabled by default.
trans-unit.target: IIS is not enabled by default.

trans-unit.source: You can enable IIS by using the Control Panel.
trans-unit.target: You can enable IIS by using the Control Panel.

trans-unit.source: Open the Control Panel and select **Programs**.
trans-unit.target: Open the Control Panel and select **Programs**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Turn Windows features on or off**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Turn Windows features on or off**.

trans-unit.source: Expand **Internet Information Services** and then expand **World Wide Web Services**.
trans-unit.target: Expand **Internet Information Services** and then expand **World Wide Web Services**.

trans-unit.source: Expand **Application Development Features** and select **ASP.NET 3.5** and **ASP.NET 4.5**.
trans-unit.target: Expand **Application Development Features** and select **ASP.NET 3.5** and **ASP.NET 4.5**.

trans-unit.source: Making these selections will automatically enable **Internet Information Services**.
trans-unit.target: Making these selections will automatically enable **Internet Information Services**.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to apply the changes.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to apply the changes.

trans-unit.source: Create and publish a secured web service
trans-unit.target: Create and publish a secured web service

trans-unit.source: Run Microsoft Visual Studio as administrator and select **New Project** from the start page.
trans-unit.target: Run Microsoft Visual Studio as administrator and select **New Project** from the start page.

trans-unit.source: Administrator access is required to publish a web service to an IIS server.
trans-unit.target: Administrator access is required to publish a web service to an IIS server.

trans-unit.source: In the New Project dialog, change the framework to **.NET Framework 3.5**.
trans-unit.target: In the New Project dialog, change the framework to **.NET Framework 3.5**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Visual C#** -> **Web** -> **Visual Studio** -> **ASP.NET Web Service Application**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Visual C#** -> **Web** -> **Visual Studio** -> **ASP.NET Web Service Application**.

trans-unit.source: Name the application "FirstContosoBank".
trans-unit.target: Name the application "FirstContosoBank".

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to create the project.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to create the project.

trans-unit.source: In the **Service1.asmx.cs** file, replace the default **HelloWorld** web method with the following "Login" method.
trans-unit.target: In the **Service1.asmx.cs** file, replace the default **HelloWorld** web method with the following "Login" method.

trans-unit.source: Save the **Service1.asmx.cs** file.
trans-unit.target: Save the **Service1.asmx.cs** file.

trans-unit.source: In the **Solution Explorer**, right-click the "FirstContosoBank" app and select **Publish**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Solution Explorer**, right-click the "FirstContosoBank" app and select **Publish**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Publish Web** dialog, create a new profile and name it "ContosoProfile".
trans-unit.target: In the **Publish Web** dialog, create a new profile and name it "ContosoProfile".

trans-unit.source: Click **Next.**
trans-unit.target: Click **Next.**

trans-unit.source: On the next page, enter the server name for your IIS server, and specify a site name of "Default Web Site/FirstContosoBank".
trans-unit.target: On the next page, enter the server name for your IIS server, and specify a site name of "Default Web Site/FirstContosoBank".

trans-unit.source: Click **Publish** to publish your web service.
trans-unit.target: Click **Publish** to publish your web service.

trans-unit.source: Configure your web service to use client certificate authentication
trans-unit.target: Configure your web service to use client certificate authentication

trans-unit.source: Run the **Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager**.
trans-unit.target: Run the **Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager**.

trans-unit.source: Expand the sites for your IIS server.
trans-unit.target: Expand the sites for your IIS server.

trans-unit.source: Under the **Default Web Site**, select the new "FirstContosoBank" web service.
trans-unit.target: Under the **Default Web Site**, select the new "FirstContosoBank" web service.

trans-unit.source: In the **Actions** section, select **Advanced Settings...**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Actions** section, select **Advanced Settings...**.

trans-unit.source: Set the **Application Pool** to **.NET v2.0** and click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Set the **Application Pool** to **.NET v2.0** and click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager**, select your IIS server and then double-click **Server Certificates**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager**, select your IIS server and then double-click **Server Certificates**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Actions** section, select **Create Self-Signed Certificate...**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Actions** section, select **Create Self-Signed Certificate...**.

trans-unit.source: Enter "ContosoBank" as the friendly name for the certificate and click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Enter "ContosoBank" as the friendly name for the certificate and click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: This will create a new certificate for use by the IIS server in the form of "<server-name>.<domain-name>".
trans-unit.target: This will create a new certificate for use by the IIS server in the form of "<server-name>.<domain-name>".

trans-unit.source: In the **Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager**, select the default web site.
trans-unit.target: In the **Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager**, select the default web site.

trans-unit.source: In the **Actions** section, select **Binding** and then click **Add...**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Actions** section, select **Binding** and then click **Add...**.

trans-unit.source: Select "https" as the type, set the port to "443", and enter the full host name for your IIS server ("<server-name>.<domain-name>").
trans-unit.target: Select "https" as the type, set the port to "443", and enter the full host name for your IIS server ("<server-name>.<domain-name>").

trans-unit.source: Set the SSL certificate to "ContosoBank".
trans-unit.target: Set the SSL certificate to "ContosoBank".

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Close** in the **Site Bindings** window.
trans-unit.target: Click **Close** in the **Site Bindings** window.

trans-unit.source: In the **Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager**, select the "FirstContosoBank" web service.
trans-unit.target: In the **Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager**, select the "FirstContosoBank" web service.

trans-unit.source: Double-click **SSL Settings**.
trans-unit.target: Double-click **SSL Settings**.

trans-unit.source: Check **Require SSL**.
trans-unit.target: Check **Require SSL**.

trans-unit.source: Under **Client certificates**, select **Require**.
trans-unit.target: Under **Client certificates**, select **Require**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Actions** section, click **Apply**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Actions** section, click **Apply**.

trans-unit.source: You can verify that the web service is configured correctly by opening your web browser and entering the following web address: "https://<server-name>.<domain-name>/FirstContosoBank/Service1.asmx".
trans-unit.target: You can verify that the web service is configured correctly by opening your web browser and entering the following web address: "https://<server-name>.<domain-name>/FirstContosoBank/Service1.asmx".

trans-unit.source: For example, "https://myserver.example.com/FirstContosoBank/Service1.asmx".
trans-unit.target: For example, "https://myserver.example.com/FirstContosoBank/Service1.asmx".

trans-unit.source: If your web service is configured correctly, you will be prompted to select a client certificate in order to access the web service.
trans-unit.target: If your web service is configured correctly, you will be prompted to select a client certificate in order to access the web service.

trans-unit.source: You can repeat the previous steps to create multiple web services that can be accessed using the same client certificate.
trans-unit.target: You can repeat the previous steps to create multiple web services that can be accessed using the same client certificate.

trans-unit.source: Create a Windows Store app that uses certificate authentication
trans-unit.target: Create a Windows Store app that uses certificate authentication

trans-unit.source: Now that you have one or more secured web services, your apps can use certificates to authenticate to those web services.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have one or more secured web services, your apps can use certificates to authenticate to those web services.

trans-unit.source: When you make a request to an authenticated web service using the [**HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) object, the initial request will not contain a client certificate.
trans-unit.target: When you make a request to an authenticated web service using the [**HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) object, the initial request will not contain a client certificate.

trans-unit.source: The authenticated web service will respond with a request for client authentication.
trans-unit.target: The authenticated web service will respond with a request for client authentication.

trans-unit.source: When this occurs, the Windows client will automatically query the certificate store for available client certificates.
trans-unit.target: When this occurs, the Windows client will automatically query the certificate store for available client certificates.

trans-unit.source: Your user can select from these certificates to authenticate to the web service.
trans-unit.target: Your user can select from these certificates to authenticate to the web service.

trans-unit.source: Some certificates are password protected, so you will need to provide the user with a way to input the password for a certificate.
trans-unit.target: Some certificates are password protected, so you will need to provide the user with a way to input the password for a certificate.

trans-unit.source: If there are no client certificates available, then the user will need to add a certificate to the certificate store.
trans-unit.target: If there are no client certificates available, then the user will need to add a certificate to the certificate store.

trans-unit.source: You can include code in your app that enables a user to select a PFX file that contains a client certificate and then import that certificate into the client certificate store.
trans-unit.target: You can include code in your app that enables a user to select a PFX file that contains a client certificate and then import that certificate into the client certificate store.

trans-unit.source: **Tip** You can use makecert.exe to create a PFX file to use with this quickstart.
trans-unit.target: **Tip** You can use makecert.exe to create a PFX file to use with this quickstart.

trans-unit.source: For information on using makecert.exe, see [MakeCert.](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/aa386968)
trans-unit.target: For information on using makecert.exe, see [MakeCert.](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/aa386968)

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio and create a new project from the start page.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio and create a new project from the start page.

trans-unit.source: Name the new project "FirstContosoBankApp".
trans-unit.target: Name the new project "FirstContosoBankApp".

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to create the new project.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to create the new project.

trans-unit.source: In the MainPage.xaml file, add the following XAML to the default **Grid** element.
trans-unit.target: In the MainPage.xaml file, add the following XAML to the default **Grid** element.

trans-unit.source: This XAML includes a button to browse for a PFX file to import, a text box to enter a password for a password-protected PFX file, a button to import a selected PFX file, a button to log in to the secured web service, and a text block to display the status of the current action.
trans-unit.target: This XAML includes a button to browse for a PFX file to import, a text box to enter a password for a password-protected PFX file, a button to import a selected PFX file, a button to log in to the secured web service, and a text block to display the status of the current action.

trans-unit.source: Save the MainPage.xaml file.
trans-unit.target: Save the MainPage.xaml file.

trans-unit.source: In the MainPage.xaml.cs file, add the following using statements.
trans-unit.target: In the MainPage.xaml.cs file, add the following using statements.

trans-unit.source: In the MainPage.xaml.cs file, add the following variables to the **MainPage** class.
trans-unit.target: In the MainPage.xaml.cs file, add the following variables to the **MainPage** class.

trans-unit.source: They specify the address for the secured "Login" method of your "FirstContosoBank" web service, and a global variable that holds a PFX certificate to import into the certificate store.
trans-unit.target: They specify the address for the secured "Login" method of your "FirstContosoBank" web service, and a global variable that holds a PFX certificate to import into the certificate store.

trans-unit.source: Update the <server-name> to the fully-qualified server name for your Microsoft Internet Information Server (IIS) server.
trans-unit.target: Update the <server-name> to the fully-qualified server name for your Microsoft Internet Information Server (IIS) server.

trans-unit.source: In the MainPage.xaml.cs file, add the following click handler for the login button and method to access the secured web service.
trans-unit.target: In the MainPage.xaml.cs file, add the following click handler for the login button and method to access the secured web service.

trans-unit.source: In the MainPage.xaml.cs file, add the following click handlers for the button to browse for a PFX file and the button to import a selected PFX file into the certificate store.
trans-unit.target: In the MainPage.xaml.cs file, add the following click handlers for the button to browse for a PFX file and the button to import a selected PFX file into the certificate store.

trans-unit.source: Run your app and log in to your secured web service as well as import a PFX file into the local certificate store.
trans-unit.target: Run your app and log in to your secured web service as well as import a PFX file into the local certificate store.

trans-unit.source: You can use these steps to create multiple apps that use the same user certificate to access the same or different secured web services.
trans-unit.target: You can use these steps to create multiple apps that use the same user certificate to access the same or different secured web services.
